sentences.sContent: Last night the headmaster promised a full investigation.
sentences.sCn: 校长昨晚允诺进行全面调查。

sentences.sContent: ‘I’ll be back by 1.00.’ ‘ Promise ?’ ‘Yes! Don’t worry.’
sentences.sCn: “我1点钟前会回来。”“你保证？”“是的！别担心。”

sentences.sContent: He reappeared two hours later, as promised.
sentences.sCn: 就像他保证过的，他两小时后再次露面。

sentences.sContent: If you make a promise, you should keep it.
sentences.sCn: 如果你许下一个诺言，你就应该遵守它。

synos.tran: 允诺，许诺；给人以…的指望或希望

phrases.pCn: [圣经]上帝允许给亚伯拉罕的地方；乐土；福地；希望之乡（等于Promised Land）

words.tran: 约定的；允诺的；约定支付的
充满希望地；大有可为地
许诺，答应（promise的现在分词形式）

trans.tranOther: to tell someone that you will definitely do or provide something or that something will happen

trans.tranCn: 答应， 允诺； 希望， 前景
trans.tranOther: A promise is a statement that you make to a person in which you say that you will definitely do something or give them something
